attributes.action: install safer railings in leeds centre after yet another person has fallen in to the river aire by accident
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
4 years ago traggically someone fell in to the river, then again 2 years ago gavin terry fell in, a petition was raised after this with a response of little effort to do anything about it, now matthew wilcox has unfortunatly fallen in to the river aswell

please can we do something about this! the goverment has a duty to protect its residents and this is being ignored, there are gaps in the railings of 1 metre wide at the bottom of calls lane and other locations around leeds's busy night life area's.

i apprecaite you cant stop people jumping over railings as described in your last response, but who said anyone intentionally jumped over a railing? they fell in at the multiple gaps in the railings found through out the centre. 

must we wait for a toddler to walk through one of these gaps and fall in before something is done about it??

rejection.details: This is a matter for direct communication with your local authority.
reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
